title: Add an optional timeout argument to Executable.__call__
body:
As a developer I want a way to call a system executable with a fixed timeout so that unexpected events won't freeze the command line.

### Rationale

Spack needs to call external executables in a few contexts (e.g. mirror creation or external spec detection). Sometimes these executables have interactive behavior and without a timeout Spack will freeze while a sub-process waits for user input.

### Description

The rationale here is to extend:

https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/4d064fd56cb0a8296311409397a0134151b6305e/lib/spack/spack/util/executable.py#L70-L104

with a `timeout` keyword argument that will kill the process and emit a proper exception if the command doesn't finish within the allotted time window.

### Additional information

To give a use case where this would be useful think of external package detection for `Intel`. With a 
regex to probe executables like:
```python
executables = ['icc']
```
things like `transicc` might match the name and be probed:
```console
$ transicc
LittleCMS ColorSpace conversion calculator - 4.3 [LittleCMS 2.09]

Enter values, 'q' to quit
R? 
<wait for user input>
```
Without a timeout Spack's command line will freeze while the subprocess waits for user input that will never come.

### General information

- [x] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
